metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9900 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
External resources that should be blocked when loaded by SVG images canbypass security restrictions through the use of "data:" URLs. This couldallow for cross-domain data leakage. This vulnerability affects Firefox <50.1, Firefox ESR < 45.6, and Thunderbird < 45.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9900` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:45.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
